Description: Rim and body sherd of Corinthian Linear Style miniature kotyle (kotyliskos); glaze fired orange-brown; interior: reserved at top, glazed below; exterior: verticals at rim, above two lines; broad band on wall and two more lines below.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 98, no. A139)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.320) (phase 3)
